reviewText: I don't know how I ever missed this show when it was on tv during the eighties, and nineties. I am making up for lost time now. Great fun, excellent crew along with the best Andy Griffith. Hate to say this , but I like it a bit more than Columbo. Thanks Andy and that great crew.
summary: THE BEST OF THE BEST ENTERTAINMENT
Title: Matlock: Season 8

reviewText: Since "growing up " with Matlock I am very partial to the show ---- excellant family entertainment ( kids 10 and older) ----  if you are able to afford it  I would recommend ALL seasons , 1 through 9 ----  as soon as season 9 comes out it will be mine as well :) --- pop some popcorn and have a nice evening ------------ Ann
Title: Matlock: Season 8

reviewText: Andy Griffith, always remembered as the gentle sheriff and the lawyer who would not lose!  Where are the Andy Griffiths today?
Title: Matlock: Season 8

reviewText: he always entertains, his costars compliment him and each other.  My 91 year old mother could watch him all day.  She loves to guess along if we don't know "who did it" and gather clues.  We have to use the captions since she has a hearing problem but it doesn't take away from this entertainment series.  We go right thru them and can't wait for the next season out.
Title: Matlock: Season 8

Title: Matlock: Season 8

reviewText: This is a great tv series that should have known when to call it quits! Indeed, SEASON 8 is a mere shadow of what the MATLOCK televison series had been earlier. Don't buy the slow-moving, tedius, pathetic SEASON 8 of "MATLOCK"---it's essentially a waste of money. I know I won't buying SEASON 9, since the rigor mortis so prominent in Season 8 is probably a preview of the ossification that gripped this show in its later years!
summary: A SAD DECLINE FOR A GREAT TV SERIES
Title: Matlock: Season 8

reviewText: A great series. I purchased the eighth season at the same time as I did the ninth and final season.  Now the series is completed and I am very pleased to have them.

Title: Matlock: Season 8

reviewText: Matlock is a wonderful courtroom drama that evokes many happy memories for me.  My cousin and I used to watch the show every time it was on, each of us providing our own speculations as to who was the culprit for each particular episode.  My cousin was always right and could have given Matlock a run for his money.The eighth season of this show is one of the best.  This season features Matlock's daughter, Leann Mackintyre, his long-time enemy, Billy Lewis, and Billy's bumbling yet delightful investigator son, Cliff.  My favorite episodes in this season or as follows:1.  "The Play": A hilareous episode in wich Ben has the lead role in a community play.  He is so terrible that the melodramatic director replaces him.  When the director is accused of murdering the leading lady in the cast, Ben is not above resorting to blackmail in order to win back his leading role.2.  "The Fatal Seduction": A two part episode in which Ben travels home to Mount Harlan to attend the funeral of his high school sweetheart, Lucy.  While there, he becomes embroiled in a case involving extortion, murder and two femme fatales determined to get what they want no matter the cost.3.  "The Diner": A heartwarming episode in which Ben relates the story of his first case, his defense of a black man accused of murdering the town's prejudiced sheriff.4.  "Matlock's Bad, Bad Dream": A funny episode in which Matlock travels back in time to the 1930's and defends a club owner with a familiar face.  Other suspects also bear strange resemblances to familiar people.  Is it just a dream or something worse?5.  "The Thief": Matlock directs his congregation's choir when the director goes on a trip.  One of the members, a college professor with a love for rare books, is accused of murder.  This is a very touching episode; one in which I felt empathy for the culprit.6.  "The Idol": A young lawyer who adopts many of Ben's methods is accused of murder after returning from a cruise to St. Thomas.These are just a few examples of the delights that await you in this wonderful collection.  The best part of this season is seeing the minuscule ways in which the perpetrators entrap themselves.  Also, Matlock's courtroom antics are priceless.Plese give this wonderful series a chance.  God bless you all.
summary: A Wonderful Series with Season 8 Being One of the Best Installments
Title: Matlock: Season 8

reviewText: There are days I cannot go without watching an episode of Matlock it is a daily regiment for me - good thing Matlock is on more than once a day.
summary: Ben Matlock is one of my favorite defense attorney's
Title: Matlock: Season 8

reviewText: I grew up watching Matlock and always loved sitting down and watching the rational, reasonable man who solves murders. I do have to admit, some of the episodes are kind of silly. One of my favorite episodes is the "Last Laugh", guest starring Milton Berle. I can't wait for season 9, oh Walt-Mart has this season for 20 bucks.
Title: Matlock: Season 8

reviewText: I would  highly recommend these series of Matlock to anyone that enjoys watching these shows.  Great memories of Andy Griffith!
